required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Study of Collaborative Assessment and Management of Suicidality With Suicidal Children ("CAMS-4Kids")
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study of Collaborative Assessment and Management of Suicidality (CAMS—Jobes, 2006; 2016) With Suicidal Children ("CAMS-4Kids")

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the feasibility and acceptability of CAMS-4Kids for children with suicidal ideation and/or behavior. During this open pilot trial, we will enhance treatment procedures, refine adherence measures, and develop a treatment manual. Our study sample will include 10 children, ages 5 - 11 years old, seeking outpatient services for suicidal ideation and/or behavior.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is an open pilot trial of one treatment without control or comparison group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Each session measured from baseline up to 12-week follow-up
primary_outcome.description: The SSF-4 measures overall suicide risk.
The CIS is a widely used measure of functional impairment.

secondary_outcome.description: The CSQ-8 is an 8 item measure of treatment satisfaction with services with both a parent and child version.

secondary_outcome.measure: Therapeutic Alliance Scale for Children, Revised (TASC-r)
secondary_outcome.description: The TASC-r is a measure of the working child-therapist working relationship.

secondary_outcome.measure: Therapeutic Alliance Scale for Caregivers and Parents (TASCP)
secondary_outcome.description: The TASCP is a measure of the working caregiver-therapist working relationship.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Each session measured from baseline up to 12-week follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: The CAMS Rating scale measures CAMS treatment fidelity.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive up to 10 sessions of CAMS-4Kids

intervention.description: The Collaborative Assessment and Management of Suicidality (CAMS—Jobes, 2006; 2016) is an evidence-based, therapeutic framework for addressing suicide risk in the adult population. CAMS-4Kids, the research intervention used in this study, is a 10-session developmentally-sensitive adaptation of CAMS for children ages 5 - 11 years old.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children between the ages of 5 - 11 years old, inclusive, at the time of consent;
- current suicidal ideation and/or behavior;
- resides with primary caregiver who has legal authority to consent to research participation
- client of outpatient Behavioral Health Services
- Outpatient or Mood and Anxiety Program visit scheduled at least 4 weeks from the diagnostic assessment and/or discharge from the Crisis Stabilization Unit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- the inability to understand study procedures (e.g. developmental disabilities, severe cognitive impairments, actively psychotic)
- inability of the child and/or parent to speak or read English
- current participation in weekly therapy sessions with outpatient Behavioral Health Crisis Team

overall_official.affiliation: Abigail Wexner Research Institute at NCH

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director, Center for Suicide Prevention and Research
